definition: background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: However, Germany is a little short on its A-listers.
sentences.chinese: 然而，德國人在人手上還是有點底氣不足。

sentences.english: statutory debt limit as early as March 31, and newlyemboldened Republican lawmakers intend to use the need to raise it as leveragefor spending cuts.
sentences.chinese: 底氣十足的共和黨議員打算靠提高它來削減開支。

sentences.english: For some reason I expected him to have a grittier voice. It must be the beard.
sentences.chinese: 由於某種原因，我預計他將更加底氣十足。

sentences.english: The salesperson in the example above didn't have clout.
sentences.chinese: 上面例子中的那名銷售人員就根本沒有底氣。

sentences.english: I felt ashamed as I weakly told him the real reason.
sentences.chinese: 我把真實原因告訴他時，底氣不足，羞愧難當。

sentences.english: Job seekers without any savings may not be in a position to say 'no.'
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何積蓄的求職者可能就沒有底氣說不。

sentences.english: Could you tell me something about Xiamen Unversity?
sentences.chinese: 看着他的眼睛的時候，我這句話說的很有底氣。

sentences.english: This arrangement which would last for ten years should help Microsoft in its aim of challenging the long permanents of Google.
sentences.chinese: 該次合作將長達十年，合作讓微軟有底氣叫板谷歌。

sentences.english: I think we have enough gas in the tank to figure out how to win.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們有足夠的底氣去贏得週四的比賽了。

sentences.english: His bottom gas is, this case reconciles the trend finally.
sentences.chinese: 他的底氣是，該案件最終將走向和解。

definition: to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
